results.adx_keywords: Presidential Election of 2020;Voter Fraud (Election Fraud);Trump, Donald J;Associated Press;Fulton County (Ga)
results.title: Jury in Georgia Trump Inquiry Recommended Multiple Indictments, Forewoman Says
results.abstract: She would not discuss specific indictments in the special grand jury’s report but noted that its recommendations were “not going to be some giant plot twist.”

media.caption: An audio recording of former President Donald J. Trump talking to Brad Raffensperger, Georgia’s secretary of state, was played in October during a hearing by the House committee investigating the Jan. 6 attack on the Capitol.

results.adx_keywords: Weather;Winter (Season);Snow and Snowstorms;Cold and Cold Spells;National Weather Service;Great Lakes;New England States (US);Northeastern States (US);Midwestern States (US);Rocky Mountains
results.byline: By Derrick Bryson Taylor and Judson Jones
results.title: Millions Across U.S. Brace for Coast-to-Coast Winter Storm
results.abstract: The storm is expected to interrupt travel plans across the country and possibly bring down power lines, forecasters said. Heavy winds disrupted California’s electrical grid on Tuesday.

media.caption: A winter storm hitting Minneapolis on Tuesday.
media.copyright: Jeff Wheeler/Star Tribune, via Associated Press

results.adx_keywords: Television;News and News Media;United States Politics and Government;Appointments and Executive Changes;Psaki, Jennifer R;Biden, Joseph R Jr;Doocy, Peter;Maddow, Rachel;Wallace, Nicolle;McEnany, Kayleigh;MSNBC;National Broadcasting Co
results.title: Jen Psaki, Once the Voice of Biden, Moves to an Anchor Chair
results.abstract: The former White House press secretary will start hosting a weekly MSNBC talk show on March 19. As for the president, “I am not going to gratuitously attack him.”

media.caption: Jen Psaki will host an MSNBC talk show on Sundays at noon.
media.copyright: Alyssa Schukar for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);United States International Relations;United States Politics and Government;Politics and Government;Biden, Joseph R Jr;Zelensky, Volodymyr;Ukraine;Kyiv (Ukraine);Russia
results.byline: By Peter Baker and Michael D. Shear
results.title: Biden’s Surreal and Secretive Journey Into a War Zone
results.abstract: President Biden traveled covertly to the besieged Ukrainian capital of Kyiv, hoping to demonstrate American resolve to help defeat the Russian forces that invaded a year ago this week.

media.caption: President Biden’s visit with President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine in Kyiv was the first trip by a modern president to a war zone not under the control of American forces.

results.adx_keywords: Presidents and Presidency (US);Politics and Government;Presidential Election of 1980;Content Type: Personal Profile;United States Politics and Government;Carter, Jimmy
results.title: Jimmy Carter’s Presidency Was Not What You Think
results.abstract: Jimmy Carter was probably the most intelligent, hard-working and decent man to have occupied the Oval Office in the 20th century.

results.adx_keywords: Politics and Government;Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);Propaganda;Education (K-12);Freedom of Speech and Expression;News and News Media;Russia;Ukraine
results.byline: By Anton Troianovski, Valerie Hopkins and Nanna Heitmann
results.title: One Year Into War, Putin Is Crafting the Russia He Craves
results.abstract: In Ukraine, President Vladimir V. Putin’s invasion has met setback after setback. But its effect at home has been very different.

media.caption: A patriotic mural in Moscow dedicated to victory in World War II. The Kremlin is tapping into Russian pride in the nation’s victory over the Nazis to demonize Ukraine.

results.adx_keywords: Elderly;Alligators;Deaths (Fatalities);Lakes;Serge, Gloria;Fort Pierce (Fla)
results.title: Alligator Kills 85-Year-Old Florida Woman as She Walks Her Dog
results.abstract: Serious injuries caused by alligators are rare in Florida, state wildlife officials said, although this was at least the third fatal encounter in the past year.

media.caption: Law enforcement officers and Florida Fish and Wildlife investigators responded to the deadly alligator attack in Fort Pierce, Fla., on Monday.
media.copyright: St. Lucie County Sheriff's Office, via Agence France-Presse — Getty Images

results.adx_keywords: Television;Women and Girls;Age, Chronological;News and News Media;Ratings (Audience Measurement);Lemon, Don;Haley, Nikki R;Licht, Christopher A (1971- );Harlow, Poppy;Collins, Kaitlan;CNN
results.byline: By Michael M. Grynbaum and John Koblin
results.title: Don Lemon Will Return to CNN on Wednesday After Uproar
results.abstract: CNN’s chairman, Chris Licht, said in a Monday night memo that the anchor “has agreed to participate in formal training” after making on-air comments widely regarded as sexist.

media.caption: Don Lemon has not appeared on his CNN morning show since Thursday, when he said that at age 51, the presidential candidate Nikki Haley was “not in her prime.”

results.adx_keywords: Birthdays;Fans (Persons);Pop and Rock Music;Art;Ono, Yoko;Central Park (Manhattan, NY)
results.title: Yoko Ono at 90
results.abstract: She has made it long past the days when she was vilified. In a ’60s-style happening in Central Park, fans sang and danced for an artist whose critical reputation is on the rise.

media.caption: Yoko Ono fans danced onstage at the Naumburg Bandshell in Central Park to celebrate her 90th birthday on Saturday.
media.copyright: Nina Westervelt for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Artificial Intelligence;Computers and the Internet;Search Engines;Conversation;internal-sub-only;Microsoft Corp;OpenAI Labs
results.title: A Conversation With Bing’s Chatbot Left Me Deeply Unsettled
results.abstract: A very strange conversation with the chatbot built into Microsoft’s search engine led to it declaring its love for me.

results.adx_keywords: Computers and the Internet;Artificial Intelligence;Rumors and Misinformation;Software;internal-sub-only;Nadella, Satya;Altman, Samuel H;Microsoft Corp;OpenAI Labs
results.title: Bing’s A.I. Chat: ‘I Want to Be Alive. 😈’
results.abstract: In a two-hour conversation with our columnist, Microsoft’s new chatbot said it would like to be human, had a desire to be destructive and was in love with the person it was chatting with. Here’s the transcript.

results.adx_keywords: Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);International Relations;United States International Relations;Wang Yi;China;Russia;Ukraine;United States
results.title: China Says U.S. Is ‘Not Qualified’ to Issue Orders on Arms
results.abstract: Beijing is trying to preserve ties with Moscow while asserting it is a neutral observer trying only to coax Russia and Ukraine into peace talks.

media.caption: Tanks congregating on the road in a village near the frontline in Eastern Ukraine this month.
media.copyright: Lynsey Addario for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Black People;Discrimination;Reparations;Eminent Domain;Land Use Policies;internal-sub-only;Bruce, Charles;Bruce, Willa;Bruce's Beach (Manhattan Beach, Calif);Los Angeles County (Calif);Manhattan Beach (Calif)
results.title: Bruce’s Beach Was Hailed as a Reparations Model. Then the Family Sold It.
results.abstract: The Bruce family won the return of oceanfront land near Los Angeles seized nearly a century ago. Their decision to sell for $20 million set off a different debate about reparations.

media.caption: Duane Shepard, a relative of the Bruce family, stands on a corner of Bruce’s Beach, overlooking the Pacific Ocean. The land was returned to the Bruce family nearly a century after it was seized by local officials.
media.copyright: Gabriella Angotti-Jones for The New York Times

results.title: The Teenager Leading the Smartphone Liberation Movement
results.abstract: Logan Lane gave up her smartphone. That changed her life.

media.copyright: Scott Rossi for The New York Times

results.title: ‘Lethargic’ Alligator Rescued From Prospect Park Lake
results.abstract: The four-foot-long alligator, now being evaluated at the Bronx Zoo, is presumed to have been abandoned by someone who kept it as a pet.
org_facet: Animal Care Centers of New York City

media.caption: The alligator found in Prospect Park Lake is now being cared for at the Bronx Zoo.

results.title: Biden Visits Embattled Ukraine as Air-Raid Siren Sounds
results.abstract: President Biden took a nearly 10-hour train ride from the border of Poland to show his administration’s “unwavering support” nearly a year into Russia’s invasion.

results.adx_keywords: Books and Literature;Children and Childhood;Writing and Writers;Freedom of Speech and Expression;Dahl, Roald;Puffin Books
results.title: Roald Dahl’s Books Are Rewritten to Cut Potentially Offensive Language
results.abstract: New editions of the best-selling author’s children’s classics, including “Charlie and the Chocolate Factory,” have been altered to eliminate words deemed inappropriate. A backlash ensued.

media.caption: Roald Dahl in 1971. His children’s books have sold millions of copies.

results.adx_keywords: Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Mandatory Sentencing;Baldwin, Alec;Gutierrez-Reed, Hannah;Santa Fe (NM)
results.title: ‘Rust’ Prosecutors Downgrade Alec Baldwin’s Manslaughter Charges
results.abstract: The actor’s lawyers had argued that a firearm law included by the prosecutors was not in effect at the time of the fatal shooting. It would have carried a mandatory five-year sentence.

media.caption: If convicted of involuntary manslaughter, Alec Baldwin and Hannah Gutierrez-Reed, the film’s armorer, would now face up to 18 months in prison.
